reviews.text: In the old days the Carrer Street was a very important place in Barcelona. The aristocrats and rich people wanted to get a spot there. Now a days all those palaces became in restaurants and gifts shops. In this street is the Picasso Museum.

We did not go to the Picasso Museum, and the Textile Museum was in the process of moving.  However, there were a lot of nice shops and restaurants on Carrer Montcada, and it's one of those very tiny streets that is typical of El Born.
This is the street were all the great medievall palaces of Barcelona are , in three of them is the great Museo Picasso, worth visiting.

Carrer de Montcada is an unassuming little street with a big secret - the wonderful El Xampanyet at 22. Heavingly full from when it opens at 7pm for the evening diners. We arrived at 7.15 and it was almost impossible to move let alone get a seat. On our visit there we sat and chatted with Belgian, American, Spanish and a variety of other nationalities who had all had this place recommended to them. The evening was not cheap but the tapas were absolutely beautiful and the Rioja was excellent!
A must-place to visit in Barcelona. Beware of pickpockets though.
